revision.comment: Reverted 1 pending edit by [[Special:Contributions/Daisyelizaporter1501|Daisyelizaporter1501]] to revision 855653787 by Power~enwiki needs sourcing
revision.text:
{{pp-pc1}} '''Ellie<!-- Do not add middle name without a reliable source --> Taylor''' (born 28 November 1983) is an English comedian. She has presented ''[[Snog Marry Avoid?]]'' on [[BBC Three]], appeared on the [[ITV2]] show ''[[Fake Reaction]]'', the [[ITV (TV network)|ITV]] reality show ''[[Show Me the Funny]]'' and the [[BBC Two]] satirical news show ''[[The Mash Report]]''.<ref name="1a">{{cite web|url=http://www.ellietaylorcomedy.com/biography/|title=Biography|year=2012|accessdate=20 May 2012|publisher=Ellie Taylor Comedy|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120505180348/http://www.ellietaylorcomedy.com/biography/|archivedate=5 May 2012|df=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/blogs/bbcthree/2012/05/snog-marry-avoid-new-series-new-presenter.shtml|title=BBC – BBC Three – Blog: Snog, Marry, Avoid? New series, new presenter!|publisher=|accessdate=5 December 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160329121953/http://www.bbc.co.uk/blogs/bbcthree/2012/05/snog-marry-avoid-new-series-new-presenter.shtml|archivedate=29 March 2016|df=}}</ref>
==Early life== Taylor studied at the [[University of York]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.itv.com/showmethefunny/comics/ellie-taylor|title=Show Me the Funny|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120125044126/http://www.itv.com/showmethefunny/comics/ellie-taylor/|archivedate=25 January 2012}}</ref>
==Career== Taylor has been a guest on ''[[8 Out of 10 Cats]]'', ''Greatest Tweets 2011'', ''Greatest BodyShockers'', ''[[Big Brother's Bit on the Side]]'', and ''[[Show Me the Funny]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/whats-on/comedy-news/ellie-taylor-stand-up-makes-8657337|title=Ellie Taylor: "Stand up makes me better at everything"|first=Sarah|last=Walters|date=16 February 2015|publisher=|accessdate=5 December 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150817012442/http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/whats-on/comedy-news/ellie-taylor-stand-up-makes-8657337|archivedate=17 August 2015|df=}}</ref> In 2011, she won Company Magazine's Lady HaHa title. In 2012, she replaced [[Jenny Frost]] as the presenter of ''[[Snog Marry Avoid?]]'' on [[BBC Three]]. She was one of the team leaders on the comedy panel show ''[[Fake Reaction]]''. In 2013, she appeared in an episode of the [[HBO]] mockumentary series ''[[Family Tree (TV series)|Family Tree]]''.
In 2014, Taylor performed her debut stand up show ''Elliementery'' at the Laughing Horse as part of the Edinburgh free fringe programme.<ref>{{cite news |last=Black |first=Suzanne |url=https://edinburghfestival.list.co.uk/article/63550-ellie-taylor-elliementary/ |title=Ellie Taylor: Elliementary – Edinburgh Festival |publisher=The List Ltd |work=The List |date=10 August 2014 |accessdate=20 June 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150621040134/https://edinburghfestival.list.co.uk/article/63550-ellie-taylor-elliementary/ |archivedate=21 June 2015 |df= }}</ref>
In June 2015, she made her debut in the [[List of Mock the Week episodes#Series 14|fourteenth series]] of BBC Two's ''[[Mock the Week]]''.<ref>{{cite news |last=Eames |first=Tom |url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/tv/news/a649720/mock-the-week-to-celebrate-10th-birthday-with-14th-series.html#~pgc7oYLEeR0KER |title=Mock the Week to celebrate 10th birthday with 14th series |publisher= |work=Digital Spy |date=28 May 2014 |accessdate=20 June 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150619060757/http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/tv/news/a649720/mock-the-week-to-celebrate-10th-birthday-with-14th-series.html#~pgc7oYLEeR0KER |archivedate=19 June 2015 |df= }}</ref>
In March 2016, Taylor made her debut in the third series of [[CBBC]]'s panel show, ''[[The Dog Ate My Homework (TV series)|The Dog Ate My Homework]]''.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.comedy.co.uk/tv/the_dog_ate_my_homework/episodes/3/9/|title=The Dog Ate My Homework Series 3, Episode 9 – British Comedy Guide|last=Guide|first=British Comedy|website=British Comedy Guide|language=en-GB|access-date=2016-11-30|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161120222150/https://www.comedy.co.uk/tv/the_dog_ate_my_homework/episodes/3/9/|archivedate=2016-11-20|df=}}</ref> She appeared a second time later that month.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.comedy.co.uk/tv/the_dog_ate_my_homework/episodes/3/12/|title=The Dog Ate My Homework Series 3, Episode 12 – British Comedy Guide|last=Guide|first=British Comedy|website=British Comedy Guide|language=en-GB|access-date=2016-11-30|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161120214853/https://www.comedy.co.uk/tv/the_dog_ate_my_homework/episodes/3/12/|archivedate=2016-11-20|df=}}</ref>
In September 2016, Taylor had a recurring role in the British TV show ''The Lodge'' as Christina.
In 2017, Taylor became a regular fill-in for [[Emma Bunton]] on London's [[Heart (radio network)|Heart Radio]] breakfast show.
Since July 2017 she has been appearing as a newsreader on ''[[The Mash Report]]''.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Dessau|first1=Bruce|title=Ellie Taylor interview: If it all ends tomorrow I can say I did it and nobody can take that away from me|url=https://www.standard.co.uk/go/london/arts/ellie-taylor-interview-if-it-all-ends-tomorrow-i-can-say-i-did-it-and-nobody-can-take-that-away-from-a3587356.html|publisher=Evening Standard|date = 13 July 2017|accessdate=29 January 2018}}</ref>
She plays ''Gloria'', the next door business owner to the main characters in the [[ITV2]] Roman comedy series, [[Plebs (TV series)|Plebs]].
On 5 July 2018, It was announced that Ellie Taylor and Anna Whitehouse would host a brand new talk show on Heart FM on Sunday nights from 10pm–1am.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.heart.co.uk/ellie-taylor-anna-whitehouse-sunday-night-heart/ |title = Ellie Taylor and Anna Whitehouse host Sunday night's on Heart}}</ref>
== Personal life == She married reporter [[Phil Black]] in London.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.dpphotography.co.uk/ellie-phil-london-bridge-wedding/|title=TV presenter Ellie Taylor marries CNN reporter Phil Black|date=2014-12-29|newspaper=London Wedding Photographer|language=en-US|access-date=2016-11-30|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161201081945/http://www.dpphotography.co.uk/ellie-phil-london-bridge-wedding/|archivedate=2016-12-01|df=}}</ref>
